intro: Condea emoryi, commonly known as Emory's condea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Condea emoryi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
